question: Sally has 20 apples. She gives 5 apples to her friend. How many apples does she have left?
Tom has 48 candies. He wants to divide them equally among 6 friends. How many candies will each friend get?
A toy store sells 15 toys every hour. How many toys will the store sell in 5 hours?
A train travels at 60 miles per hour. How far will the train travel in 4 hours?
A book has 25 pages. John reads 5 pages every day. How many days will it take John to finish reading the book?
A rectangular room is 10 feet wide and 15 feet long. What is the area of the room?
A pizza has 8 slices. Each slice costs $2. How much does the whole pizza cost?
Lily has 7 marbles. She wants to share them equally with her 3 friends. How many marbles will each friend get?
A bakery sells 4 types of pastries. Each type of pastry comes in a box of 6. How many pastries are there in total?
A water bottle can hold 500 milliliters of water. If it is filled with 250 milliliters of water, how much more water can be added?
A store sells pencils in packs of 12. If a student buys 3 packs, how many pencils does the student have in total?
There are 24 students in a class. The teacher wants to divide the students into 4 equal groups. How many students will be in each group?
A store sells 30 books per day. How many books will the store sell in a week?
A car travels 90 miles in 3 hours. How many miles does the car travel in 1 hour?
If a movie ticket costs $9 and a popcorn costs $4, how much will it cost for 2 people to watch the movie and buy popcorn?
A farmer has 18 chickens and 6 cows. How many legs are there in total?
Anna bought a dress for $45 and a pair of shoes for $35. How much did she spend in total?
A box contains 5 red balls and 3 blue balls. What fraction of the balls are red?
A bicycle has a front wheel with a diameter of 20 inches and a rear wheel with a diameter of 24 inches. What is the difference in the diameter of the two wheels?
Sam has 3 quarters, 2 dimes, and 5 pennies. How much money does Sam have in total?
